title: ISic030042
support: Lamina. Broken into twelve heavily damaged and burnt fragments, of which 4 are the most complete and legible.

condition._: Fragment 1 is not contiguous with fragment 5, which consists of three contiguous fragments and is the upper right corner of the recto of one lamina.

layout.p: The text is boustrophedon and runs on both face a and face b of the lamina. Two of the larger fragments are included here. Text fragment 5 is the upper right-hand end of the lamina.

provenanceFound._:
Found in Monte San Mauro (di Caltagirone), at the top of Hill 3 (in Orsi's 1910 numbering), 30 cm below the ground level, 
                            in the area where the building in square blocks that Orsi interpreted as an 'anaktoron' was found. The fragments would have penetrated the rammed earth, which was the original walking surface of the structure..

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
